title: Bio-Android Nursery Adventure #66
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Incubation Laboratory
rooms.description: A sterile white laboratory filled with rows of glowing incubation pods. Inside each pod, partially formed bio-android bodies float in nutrient solution. Monitors display vital signs and growth percentages. The air is cool and smells of antiseptic. Warning lights blink on several control panels, and a soft humming fills the space.

items.name: research workstation
items.description: A sleek desk with holographic displays and data terminals

items.name: research log datapad
items.description: A digital tablet containing research notes
items.text: Research Log - Day 2157: The nursery facility was established in the year 2157 to create the next generation of bio-androids. Dr. Helena Voss leads the project. Chief Engineer Marcus Kane maintains all systems. The neural programming is conducted in the Control Center.

items.name: medical supply cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with three compartments containing medical equipment

items.name: facility operations manual
items.description: A manual detailing facility procedures
items.text: Bio-Android Nursery Operations Manual: This facility creates advanced bio-androids through a three-stage process. Stage 1: Physical incubation. Stage 2: Neural programming in the Control Center. Stage 3: Final activation. Access code to secure storage is the facility founding year: 2157.

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A magnetic keycard with blue security clearance

items.name: incubation pod alpha
items.description: A large cylindrical pod containing a developing bio-android
items.text: Pod Status: Subject Alpha-7. Growth: 87%. Neural pathways forming. Estimated completion: 48 hours. Note: All bio-androids receive programming in the Control Center before activation.

items.name: secure storage locker
items.description: A locked metal locker with a keycard reader

items.name: personnel roster
items.description: A document listing facility staff
items.text: PERSONNEL ROSTER: Dr. Helena Voss - Project Director, Neural Programming. Chief Engineer Marcus Kane - Systems Maintenance and Security. Dr. Sarah Chen - Biological Development. All emergency protocols require Director authorization.

items.name: electronic maintenance tool
items.description: A multi-purpose tool for facility repairs

items.name: control center door
items.description: A reinforced door with a security panel leading to the Control Center

rooms.name: Neural Programming Control Center
rooms.description: A high-tech command center with banks of computers and holographic displays showing neural network diagrams. Large screens display bio-android consciousness patterns. The room hums with processing power. A master control console dominates the center, and emergency evacuation protocols are displayed on a wall screen.

items.name: master control console
items.description: The primary control station for all nursery operations
items.text: SYSTEM STATUS: Neural programming active. Bio-android development on schedule. Emergency evacuation bay accessible via east corridor. Warning: Evacuation requires Director authorization and proper security clearance.

items.name: neural network display
items.description: A holographic display showing complex neural patterns
items.text: Neural Programming Interface: All bio-androids receive their core programming here in the Control Center. Dr. Voss personally oversees each neural imprint to ensure optimal cognitive function.

items.name: engineering workstation
items.description: Chief Engineer Kane's desk with technical manuals and tools

items.name: emergency evacuation protocol
items.description: A document outlining emergency procedures
items.text: EMERGENCY EVACUATION PROTOCOL: In case of facility emergency, proceed to evacuation bay. Access requires security verification. Questions: 1) Who directs neural programming? 2) Where is neural programming conducted? 3) Who authorizes emergency protocols?

items.name: data access terminal
items.description: A terminal with access to facility records

items.name: project summary report
items.description: A comprehensive report on the bio-android project
items.text: PROJECT SUMMARY: Under the leadership of Dr. Helena Voss, the Bio-Android Nursery has successfully created 66 advanced bio-androids. Neural programming conducted in the Control Center ensures each unit has optimal cognitive abilities. Director Voss maintains final authority over all operations.

items.name: emergency information screen
items.description: A large screen displaying emergency procedures
items.text: EMERGENCY PROCEDURES: All evacuations must be authorized by the Project Director. Neural programming is the critical phase conducted in this Control Center. Follow all security protocols during evacuation.

items.name: evacuation bay door
items.description: A heavy security door leading to the emergency evacuation bay. A biometric panel displays three security questions.

password_questions.question: Who directs neural programming?
password_questions.hint: Check the personnel roster and project summary

password_questions.question: Where is neural programming conducted?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents mention where this critical process takes place

password_questions.question: Who authorizes emergency protocols?
password_questions.hint: The evacuation protocol and personnel roster explain the chain of command

rooms.name: Emergency Evacuation Bay
rooms.description: You have reached the emergency evacuation bay! A sleek escape shuttle sits on its launch platform, engines humming with readiness. Through the transparent launch tube, you can see the stars beyond the facility. Control panels show all systems green. The shuttle door stands open, inviting you to safety.

items.name: emergency escape shuttle
items.description: A compact spacecraft designed for rapid evacuation

items.name: shuttle launch platform
items.description: The platform holding the escape shuttle, ready for immediate departure

items.name: launch control panel
items.description: Controls showing all systems ready for launch
items.text: LAUNCH SYSTEMS: All green. Shuttle fueled and ready. Destination: Orbital Station Gamma. Launch sequence can be initiated immediately.

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You board the escape shuttle and initiate the launch sequence. The engines roar to life as the shuttle lifts off from the Bio-Android Nursery facility. Through the viewport, you watch the nursery shrink below as you accelerate toward the safety of Orbital Station Gamma. You have successfully escaped! You win!
